alert.note: Alert for Clay; Fillmore; Franklin; Furnas; Hamilton; Harlan; Nuckolls; Polk; Thayer; Webster; York (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued December 24 at 8:57AM CST until December 27 at 6:00AM CST by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...SIGNIFICANT WINTER STORM LIKELY CHRISTMAS DAY THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT... ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH LATE TUESDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations between 4 and 11 inches possible. Northwest inds could gust as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Portions of north central Kansas and east central and south central Nebraska. * WHEN...From late tonight through late Tuesday night. * IMPACTS...Roads, and especially bridges and overpasses, will likely become slick and hazardous. Whiteout conditions are possible and may make travel treacherous and potentially life-threatening. Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the Monday morning and evening commutes. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Even at this shorter forecast time range, there is still above-average uncertainty in the snowfall forecast, and the latest computer model trends suggest that many places could end up near the lower end of the expected accumulation range.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. Persons should consider delaying all travel. If travel is absolutely necessary, drive with extreme caution. Consider taking a winter storm kit along with you, including such items as tire chains, booster cables, flashlight, shovel, blankets and extra clothing. Also take water, a first aid kit, and anything else that would help you survive in case you become stranded.
